==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|た|o1=ち|い|o2=り|きん|し}}

===Etymology===
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=たちいりきんし|立入|tr1=tachiiri|t1=entry”, stem of verb {{l|ja|立ち入る|tr=''tachiiru''}}, “to enter an area, to enter into someone's affairs|禁止|tr2=kinshi|t2=forbidden, prohibited}}.

===Pronunciation===
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|訓読み|Kun'yomi}} for ''tachiiri'', {{l|ja|sc=Latn|音読み|on'yomi}} for ''kinshi''
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[ta̠t͡ɕiiɾi kĩɴɕi]}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|たち.いり きんし}}

# [[no entry]]

====Usage notes====
Commonly used on signs.
